question: Merkel cells are present in
exp: Merkel cells Touch receptors Type 1 slow adapting Present in stratum basale in epidermis

question: Two year old child presented with multiple bone defects and seborrheic dermatitis. Diagnosis ?
exp: Letterer Siwe disease - - child- <2yrs - generalised systemic involvement - Bone>skin>hepatosplenomgaly with lymphadenopathy -Skin- mc manifestation is seborrheic dermatitis. Current Classification Single-system Disease - either Localized (single site) or Multiple siteMultisystem Disease - Low-risk group (Disseminated disease with involvement of low-risk organs (skin, bone, lymphnode, pituitary) or High-risk group (Disseminated disease with involvement of one or more of the high-risk organs(hematopoietic system, lungs, liver, and spleen)

question: Meissner's corpuscles present in which layer of skin?
exp: Meissner's corpuscles (Tactile corpuscles) are a type of mechanoreceptor, responsible for sensitivity to light touch. -Location-most concentrated in thick hairless skin and in areas especially sensitive to light touch, such as the fingers and lips. -More specifically, they are primarily located in glabrous skin just beneath the epidermis within the dermal papillae.

question: Superficial reactive unit consists of all except :
exp: Superficial reactive unit consists of: Epidermis Dermoepidermal junction Papillary dermis Superficial vascular plexus Deep reactive unit consists of: Reticular dermis Deep vascular plexus

question: Parakeratosis most frequently occurs in which of the following?
exp: Parakeratosis - retention of nucleus in stratum corneum Parakeratosis is seen in - PEA'S2 - Psoriasis- Eczema- Actinic keratosis- Seborrheic dermatitis- Squamous cell carcinoma Seborrheic keratosisIt is benign, presents with keratotic papules with stuck on appearance and these lesions suggest underlying malignancy like gastric adenocarcinoma.Also k/a Leser-Trelet sign Actinic keratosis It is premalignant condition, keratotic papules seen over sun exposed areas

question: Which of these layers has abundance of desmosomes?
exp: Stratum spinosum or prickle cell layer under microscope show multiple spine like processes over surface of keratinocytes known as Desmosomes, which are most abundant in this layer.

question: Which of the following statements is false about anatomy of skin?
exp: Anatomy of skin - * Skin - largest organ of body* Weighs around 15-16%TBW* Epidermis derived from Ectoderm* Dermis derived from Mesoderm Cells in epidermis Derived from Keratinocytes [?]85-90% Ectoderm Melanocytes Neural crest Langerhans cells Bone marrow(mesoderm) Merkel cell Ectoderm>Neural crest Most abundant fibers in dermis are collagen fibers Most commonly seen are collagen type 1 & 3. Type 1- most abundant Dermal collagen type 1: type 3 = 4:1
opa: Dermal collagen 1 and 3 are in a ratio of 8:1 in dermis
opb: Skin weighs about 15 % of body weight
opc: Epidermis is derived from ectoderm and dermis from mesoderm
opd: 90% of cells in the epidermis are keratinocytes

question: The distribution of keratins (K) in the basal layers is:
exp: Basal layer has keratin types K5/K14 Keratin Heterodimer Sites K 5/14 Stratum basale - If defective- Epidermolysis Bullosa simplex K 1/10 Stratum Spinosum K 2/11 Stratum Granulosum K 3/12 Cornea - If defective - Corneal dystrophy K 4/13 Buccal mucosa K 6/16 Nails K 8/18 Liver - If defective - Liver cirrhosis

question: Haascheiben cells in epidermis are responsible for ?
exp: Merkel cells or Haascheiben cells are located amongst basal keratinocytes and are mainly found in hairy skin, tactile areas of glabrous skin, taste buds, anal canal, labial epithelium and eccrine sweat glands, all regions of high tactile acuity. Merkel cells are easily identifiable on transmission electron microscopy. They are oval with a long axis of approximately 15 mm, orientated parallel to the basement membrane.

question: All the following statements regarding skin are true except
exp: Keratinization provides protection, has no role in hydration of cells. The skin has three layers-- the epidermis, dermis and subcutaneous layer (fat layer). Keratinization is a process of cytodifferentiation in which the keratinocytes are differentiated, hardened cell filled with keratin which serves as a scaffold for the cytoskeleton and play a major functional role in the integrity and mechanical stability of cells. Filaggrin helps in keratin assembly and then degrades to for amino acids and natural moisturizing factors which help in skin hydration.
opc: Keratin filaments are hallmark of epidermal cells

question: All are ocular features of Albinism except
exp: Albinism/Occulo-cutaneous disorder - Defective melanogenesis Depigmented skin and hair Autosomal recessive, mutation in Tyrosinase (TYR) gene Associated with photophobia and increased risk of skin malignancies(SCC) The ocular findings in OCA correlate with the degree of hypopigmentation and include decreased visual acuity, nystagmus, photophobia, strabismus, and a lack of normal binocular vision.

question: Which is antigen presenting cell in the epidermis that is required for the induction of allergic contact dermatitis is:
exp: Langerhans' cell is a specialized antigen-presenting cell that help in antigen recognition and activation T cell mediated immune response. Functions - phagocytosis, antigen processing, antigen presentation, interaction with lymphocytes. Release IL-1 Langerhans cells are derived from mesoderm Langerhans cells are present in stratum spinosum Birbeck granules - rod or racquet shaped - contain Langerin Langerhans' cell decrease in (PSC) Psoriasis Sarcoidosis Contact dermatitis Langerhans' cell increase in - Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis

question: Characteristic skin lesion in Peutz -Jeghers syndrome is
exp: Peutz Jegher syndrome. Peutz-Jeghers syndrome- Autosomal dominant - Lentigens (increased melanocytes leading to hyperpigmented macules) - Site of lentigen - Perioral(lips),Buccal mucosa - Associated with GI polyp. (MC : Jejunal hamaoma)Freckles /ephelides* It is increased localized melanogenesis.* Normally seen in fairer skin colour (Skin type I,II)* Become dark on sun exposure Adenoma Sebaceum is seen in Tuberous sclerosis aka epiloia Cafe au lait macules is seen in Neurofibromatosis (dark color lesion over lighter skin).
